description: Carolina allspice (Calycanthus raulstonii 'Hartlage Wine') is an amazing, fragrant and ornamental plant species. Its buttery yellow, red, and purple flowers attract hummingbirds, and a sweet aroma fills the air when the petal-like petals protrude from the tubular flowers. Its foliage is bright and deep green, turning to shades of red-purple in Autumn. This slow-growing species grows well in sunny, shady, and partial shade environments, making it a great addition to any garden. Further, its multi-stemmed and shrub-like structure makes it ideal for planting as a tight hedge. Carolina allspice is easy to maintain and can provide years of beauty and fragrance in any landcape!
